Even if your views aren't changed, debating, listening, and reading are invaluable in promoting a democratic and fairer society.
Just as the #Article50 debates have shown - listening to others, and those who disagree with us, is so important in challenging your views.
I think the best thing I'm taking out of the #Sessionshearing is the importance of acknowledging past mistakes and changing perspectives.
Senator Leahy speaking incredibly movingly on the importance of domestic violence protection schemes in the #Sessionshearing.

@FernRiddell @trillingual has started a great list of organisations that UK and Europe-based people can get in touch/involved with.

It might not be much, but the news would crumple me too much if I didn't try to do something. Whose addresses do I need?
I feel that this evening will involve more letter writing, donations (to civil liberties/refugee orgs in US & UK), and more reading.

@alicetheunique @M_James_IOSHist on the 9/11...not just for fun. I mainly remember registration the next morning - the chatter abt it.
@alicetheunique @M_James_IOSHist We drove round a roundabout & retail park for what felt like an hour listening to the radio after school.
@M_James_IOSHist @alicetheunique That's so odd, but actually I just thought of it and it fits together in my memory of that time...
@M_James_IOSHist @alicetheunique Beslan school seige. I remember 9/11 and the suchlike, but that was the 1st that I devoured everything on.
Women were featured in news footage so their roles were nodded to, but their voices were notably absent from an o/w q rounded documentary
One suffragette was mentioned for her hunger strike - she wasn't named. Every other male revolutionary was.
All 11 of those instances (2/3 Thatcher, 1 woman just yelling Up the Provos) were from archive footage. Not a single female talking head.
However, I (and others) were struck at the almost complete absence of women's voices - I counted 11 instances in the whole film.
I thought the times and influences of 1981 (domestic and international) were brought to life in a variety of ways.
Just been to see 'Bobby Sands: 66 Days' with the @MIH_Edin crowd. Fascinating film which brought different views & moments together well.
Highly recommend Pickles in Edinburgh for delicious wine, bread, and cheese (so much cheese). What a delightful aft… https://t.co/kfSkUXxXZl
